results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n >= 1, 1 <= k <= n) = number of alternating anagrams on n letters (of length 2n) which are decomposable into at most k components.
comment: The Bell transform of A218827(n+1). For the definition of the Bell transform see A264428. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 17 2016
link: Kreweras, G. and Dumont, D., Sur les anagrammes alternés. (French) [On alternating anagrams] Discrete Math. 211 (2000), no. 1-3, 103--110. MR1735352 (2000h:05013).
mathematica: m = 10(*terms of A218827 for m-1 rows*); matc = Array[0&, {m, m}];
(* The function BellMatrix is defined in A264428.*)

ci[n_, k_] := ci[n, k] = Module[{v}, If[matc[[n, k]] == 0, If[n == k, v = 1, If[k == 1, v = c[n], v = Sum[Binomial[n - 1, i - 1]*c[i]*ci[n - i, k - 1], {i, 1, n - k + 1}]]]; matc[[n, k]] = v]; Return[matc[[n, k]] ]];
Table[T[[n, k]], {n, 1, m - 1}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 03 2019 *)
